intro: Dioscorea transversa, commonly known as the transverse yam, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are the primary edible part of the plant. The plant produces small, green, heart-shaped leaves and unisexual flowers that are typically borne in clusters. Its tubers are often used as a food source and have been traditionally utilized in various medicinal practices. The plant's growth habit and morphology make it well adapted to its tropical and subtropical habitats.
